item.properties: Asparagus is an erect, unarmed, branched herbaceous perennial herb, growing up to 1 meter in height. Leaves (scales) are very minute, and the cladodes (branchlets) fascicled, slender terete, 0.5 to 1.5 centimeters long. Flowers are axillary, fascicled, solitary or in pairs, pedicelled, the perianth straw-yellow or greenish yellow, about 5 millimeters long. Fruit is globose, 6 to 10 millimeters in diameter, fleshy red when ripe.
item.usage: Green resin used for flatulence, calculous affections, cardiac dropsy, rheumatism, and chronic gout.||Given in doses of 1 to 2 grains, combined with potassium bromide, for cardiac dropsy and chronic gout.||Water in which asparagus was boiled, although disagreeable, is good for rheumatism.||In Brazil, roots considered a powerful diuretic.||Roots also used for bronchial catarrh and pulmonary tuberculosis.||In Tehran, roots are burned and smoked to relieve toothaches.||Rhizome is used as cardiac sedative, palliative, diuretic, and laxative.
